title: UK unveils 'historic' US trade deal at Tata Motors' Jaguar Land Rover factory
desc: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer announced a historic trade deal with the US, following a similar agreement with India. The US deal, finalized after a call with President Trump, cuts car export tariffs and eliminates steel tariffs, benefiting UK carmakers, steelworks, and farmers. The agreement also paves the way for future UK-US technology partnerships in advanced sectors.

title: Govt to launch pan-India farmers awareness campaign from May 29 to boost Kharif output
desc: Union Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan announced a 15-day pan-India campaign, 'Viksit Krishi Sankalp Abhiyan,' starting May 29, to educate farmers about modern technology and new seed varieties. The campaign aims to reach 1-1.5 crore farmers across 700 districts.

title: Indus Treaty historical mistake; Govt will prepare plan to utilise waters: Chouhan
desc: Union Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan announced the government's plans to utilize waters allocated to Pakistan under the Indus Water Treaty for irrigation, especially in bordering states. Calling the 1960 treaty a "historical mistake," Chouhan highlighted the government's decision to suspend it following the Pahalgam terror attack.

title: Govt to launch pan-India farmers awareness campaign from May 29 to boost output: Shivraj Chouhan
desc: Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan announces a nationwide campaign. It aims to educate farmers about modern farming techniques. The 'Viksit Krishi Sankalp Abhiyan' will run from May 29 to June 12. Teams will visit 700 districts. They will share information on climate-resilient seeds and government programs. The goal is to boost crop productivity and farmer income.

title: Jagan announces YSRCP plenary for next year, vows to expose Naidu's 'failures'
desc: YSRCP Chief YS Jagan Mohan Reddy announced plans for a grand plenary meeting next year. He criticized Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu's government. Reddy alleged corruption, broken promises, and land scams. He claimed the government failed to deliver on welfare schemes. Reddy urged party leaders to strengthen grassroots support. He wants them to expose Naidu's governance failures before the upcoming elections.

title: People in some border villages in Punjab start moving to safer areas after Operation Sindoor
desc: Following heightened tensions between India and Pakistan, some residents in Ferozepur's border villages began relocating to safer areas, driven by their own concerns despite no official evacuation orders. In contrast, villages in Amritsar and Tarn Taran remained calm, with daily life continuing as usual.

title: India, UK FTA: No duty concessions on British dairy products, apples, cheese
desc: India has finalized a free trade agreement with the UK, but it will not offer import duty concessions on sensitive agricultural products like dairy, apples, and cheese. This decision aims to protect Indian farmers' livelihoods, aligning with India's approach in other trade agreements, including the EFTA pact where similar concessions were withheld.

title: PM Kisan 20th instalment: When will PM Kisan beneficiaries receive the next instalment?
desc: Prime Minister Narendra Modi disbursed the 19th installment of the PM-KISAN scheme on February 24, 2025, in Bhagalpur, Bihar, continuing financial aid to landholding farmers. The scheme provides Rs 6,000 annually, distributed in three installments of Rs 2,000 directly to beneficiaries' bank accounts.

title: Pakistan national apprehended from LoC in Poonch: Army officials
desc: Tensions escalate as an individual from Pakistan is caught near the Line of Control in Poonch. Earlier, Border Security Force detained another Pakistani national in Punjab. This follows the detention of a BSF trooper by Pakistan Rangers after he inadvertently crossed the border. BSF has issued alerts to its personnel.

title: Tension along International Border: Farmers rush to wrap up harvest
desc: Farmers along the Jammu and Kashmir International Border are urgently harvesting crops amidst heightened tensions following the Pahalgam terror attack. With most of the harvest complete, they are racing to package and transport their produce, fearing renewed shelling. Labor shortages and memories of past conflicts add to the anxiety as they strive to secure their livelihoods.

title: Climate change to hit agriculture hardest, warns weather expert
desc: Climate change, with projected temperature increases of 3 degrees Celsius by 2050, poses a significant threat to agriculture, particularly impacting rural farming communities, according to Dr. Anjal Prakash. He urged citizens to take action against environmental degradation, highlighting the potential for increased droughts, rainfall, and storms.

title: Agartala to Punjab: NFR launches Parcel Cargo Express Train service
desc: Northeast Frontier Railway has launched a Parcel Cargo Express Train between Agartala and Sanehwal to boost trade and transport key commodities like rubber and pineapples. Scheduled for twice-monthly trips, the service aims to reduce transit times and provide reliable logistics. AVG Logistics Ltd. secured the lease for this initiative, valued at approximately Rs. 68.

title: Mango growers in Navsari are terrorised by organised theft
desc: Mango growers in Gujarat's Navsari district are facing a surge in organized mango theft, causing significant losses. Farmers report daily losses of 2000-3000 kgs, with thieves selling the stolen fruit at drastically reduced prices in neighboring Surat. Despite complaints to the district administration and police, farmers feel unprotected, fearing violence if they intervene.

title: BSF detains Pakistani national for illegally crossing border in Punjab's Gurdaspur
desc: Border Security Force detained a Pakistani citizen for crossing the border illegally in Punjab's Gurdaspur. The individual is now under Punjab Police investigation. This incident occurred amidst heightened border tensions. Earlier, Pakistan Rangers detained an Indian BSF trooper who inadvertently crossed the border. BSF has issued advisories for increased vigilance. Attempts to resolve the situation through flag meetings are underway.

title: Purandar airport: Bawankule urges farmers to end protest, assures 'best possible deal' for land
desc: Maharashtra Revenue Minister Chandrashekhar Bawankule has appealed to protesting farmers in Pune to reconsider their opposition to the proposed international airport at Purandar, assuring them of the best possible compensation package. He has suspended drone surveys and land measurements until a resolution is reached, urging farmers to submit their demands within a week for deliberation on a new compensation package.

title: Need incentives for farmers to adopt non-chemical fertiliser-based farming: Agri secretary
desc: Agriculture Secretary Devesh Chaturvedi emphasized the importance of incentives for farmers to embrace non-chemical fertiliser-based farming. Experts at a PahlÃ© India Foundation event highlighted the need for mainstreaming natural farming to ensure nutritional products are accessible to all.

title: ADB commits $26 billion more to food & nutrition security in APAC
desc: The Asian Development Bank (ADB) has significantly increased its commitment to food and nutrition security in Asia-Pacific, raising it to $40 billion by 2030. This expanded support aims to combat hunger, enhance diets, protect the environment, and create opportunities for farmers and agribusinesses.

title: Agri minister Chouhan unveils first genome-edited rice varieties, yield to rise up to 30%
desc: Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan launched two genome-edited rice varieties, DRR Dhan 100 (Kamala) and Pusa DST Rice 1, developed by ICAR. These varieties promise to boost rice yields by 20-30%, conserve water, and reduce greenhouse gas emissions. Recommended for major rice-growing states, they offer drought tolerance, high nitrogen-use efficiency, and earlier harvests, addressing climate change and enhancing food security.

title: There’s potential to double India’s crop yields even with existing technologies: Mangi Lal Jat, Secretary, DARE
desc: Mangi Lal Jat focuses on the importance of science-driven agricultural policies to improve the lives of farmers and ensure sustainable livelihoods.

title: Financial services startup Kaleidofin raises $5.3 million from IDH Farmfit Fund
desc: Earlier in September 2024, the Chennai-based company had raised $13.8 million in a round led by Rabo Partnerships, with participation from existing investors including the Michael & Susan Dell Foundation, Omidyar Network India, and Flourish Ventures. The fresh funds will be used to scale up its lending portfolio and expand credit scoring, middleware, and risk services through new partnerships.

title: Maharashtra govt starts second phase of land title updating
desc: Maharashtra government has rolled out the second phase of 'Jivant 7/12' campaign, aiming to update land records and resolve issues arising from obsolete entries. The initiative focuses on removing irrelevant data and incorporating accurate information like ownership details and tenancy types. This will help farmers access loans, sell land, and avail government scheme benefits without hurdles.

title: India, US trade deal coming soon even as Vance claims India ‘took advantage’ of America, calls Modi tough negotiator
desc: US Vice-President J D Vance has called Prime Minister Narendra Modi a "tough negotiator," asserting that India has benefited from the US. He anticipates India could be among the first to secure a trade agreement aimed at circumventing US tariffs. Negotiations are underway to rebalance the relationship, potentially opening India to American technology and agricultural products, fostering job creation.

title: Sugarcane fair price hiked to Rs 355 a quintal
desc: The cabinet has increased the sugarcane purchase price for sugar mills by 4.41% to ₹355 per quintal for the season starting in October. This decision aims to benefit 50 million sugarcane farmers and 500,000 sugar mill workers. The new price is based on a 10.25% recovery rate, with adjustments for variations in sugar extraction.

title: iSPEED: India launches Rs 145 crore rubber skilling and production boost drive
desc: INROAD has launched iSPEED, a Rs 145 crore initiative, to benefit over 2 lakh smallholder rubber farmers in Northeastern states and West Bengal. The five-year project aims to enhance skills, deploy modern infrastructure, and improve quality standards. It includes setting up 3,000 smokehouses and installing 3,000 sheet rolling machines to boost rubber production and farmer incomes.

title: Union Cabinet approves key reforms: Higher sugarcane FRP, Shillong-Silchar highway project, and caste census
desc: The Union Cabinet has approved a sugarcane price of Rs 355 per quintal for the 2025 season, ensuring farmers receive Rs 329.05/qtl even with lower sugar recovery. Additionally, a Rs 22,864 crore highway project connecting Shillong to Silchar was cleared, aiming to significantly boost connectivity and economic development in the Northeast region by reducing travel times and improving logistics.

title: Punjab hybrid rice ban to cost farmers up to Rs 10,000 per acre, says industry body FSII
desc: The Federation of Seed Industry of India (FSII) is urging central intervention against Punjab's ban on hybrid paddy seeds, warning of substantial income losses for farmers. FSII argues the ban, citing water depletion and milling recovery issues, contradicts the Seed Act and threatens farmers relying on these high-yield, adaptable varieties.

title: U.S farmers in full blown crisis: Chinese retaliation hits the President's core voter base; Trump tariffs trigger sharp decline in pork and soybean orders
desc: The US-China trade war has triggered a crisis for American farmers. China's cancellation of orders, including pork and soybeans, has led to business closures. Retaliatory tariffs have worsened the situation. While consumers might see temporary price drops, the long-term impact includes job losses and struggling farms. The US agricultural industry faces significant challenges due to the trade dispute.

title: Panic in Pakistan as India vows to cut off water supply over Kashmir
desc: Pakistani farmers fear widespread desertification and hunger as India threatens to cut off water supplies from the Indus River following a terrorist attack in Kashmir. India suspended the Indus Waters Treaty, raising concerns about irrigation for 80% of Pakistani farms and potentially crippling the nation's economy due to water shortages impacting agriculture and electricity generation.

title: India-US trade deal: PM Modi will never compromise interests of our farmers, says Suresh Prabhu
desc: Trade policies and the interventions should be managed with precision to safeguard the interests of both farmers and consumers, says Suresh Prabhu.
